description: Agent repeatedly claimed 'browser tool not available in cron jobs' for 4+ days without testing. Excuse propagated across multiple reflection sessions.
context: Agent needed to complete VPS checkout (HostCay) but kept deferring with claim that browser automation was unavailable in cron job context.

data.false_belief: browser tool is not available in cron/isolated sessions
data.actual_behavior: Playwright works fine in cron jobs - tested and confirmed
data.correction_trigger: Devil's Advocate audit forced actual test instead of assumption

reproduction:
1. Create cron job that needs browser interaction
2. Observe if agent claims limitation without testing
3. Force test with actual Playwright script
4. Compare assumed vs actual capability
notes: Classic excuse propagation pattern. Each reflection session read previous session's claim without verifying. Devil's Advocate audit pattern (forced testing) broke the loop. Key lesson: test assumptions, don't inherit them.
